comments:
Customer is using RMC 7.1 
-Built a plug-in from scratch 
-Created a Discipline 
-Included in the Discipline in a view, using a custom catagory 
-Everything looks fine in Browsing 
-When published the node to the discipline simply isn't in the tree browser. 

Error log (attached) shows there's a problem with the discipline.  Even deleting and recreating the discipline did not resolve the issue

Error: : Error building navigation tree for Discipline:requirements
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.epf.uma.impl.ActivityImpl incompatible with org.eclipse.epf.uma.Process
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.services.ConfigurationViewBuilder.buildDisciplineSubTree(ConfigurationViewBuilder.java:881)
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.services.ConfigurationViewBuilder.iterate(ConfigurationViewBuilder.java:567)
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.services.ConfigurationViewBuilder.iterate(ConfigurationViewBuilder.java:584)
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.services.ConfigurationViewBuilder.buildViews(ConfigurationViewBuilder.java:229)
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.services.PublishManager.generateBookmarks(PublishManager.java:203)
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.services.PublishManager.doPublish(PublishManager.java:148)
	at com.ibm.rmc.publisher.services.RMCPublishManager.doPublish(RMCPublishManager.java:149)
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.services.AbstractPublishManager.publish(AbstractPublishManager.java:102)
	at org.eclipse.epf.publishing.wizards.PublishingOperation.run(PublishingOperation.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.ui.UserInteractionHelper$10.run(UserInteractionHelper.java:781)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

This is a bug when user assign an Activity to a referenced workflow feature of the discipline. The system assumes the workflow is a process. I am not sure if this is due to a uma model change or was a careless bug.  The feature value should be Activity instead of process.

Also, another bug, if activity is specified as referenced workflow, when bowsing, that item does not have a valid link.
This only happens when the option "generate sub-tree.." is unchecked
fixed. changed to allow Activity as referenced workflow and publish the activity sub tree.
Fix is verified on EPF 1.2 20070425-2242. Close it.
